issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: Unfortunately when doing this : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-19886 I forgot to do it as well for the metastore
fields.summary: Logs may be directed to 2 files if --hiveconf hive.log.file is used (metastore)

comments.body: Yeah. That's probably safer (to throw exception and recommend them to use the same file in properties file and hive.log.file).

GitHub user beltran opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/409

    HIVE-20283: Logs may be directed to 2 files if --hiveconf hive.log.fi…

    …le is used (metastore)

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/beltran/hive HIVE-20283

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/409.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #409
    
----
commit a60c2297aa0639cf2fe4c68aa9cc44a550dd3384
Author: Jaume Marhuenda <jaumemarhuenda@...>
Date:   2018-08-06T20:01:04Z

    HIVE-20283: Logs may be directed to 2 files if --hiveconf hive.log.file is used (metastore)

----
